## Censorship of "Brave New World" in the Soviet Union and Eastern Europe

Brave New World has frequently been banned and challenged since its original publication. It has landed on the American Library Association list of top 100 banned and challenged books of the decade since the association began the list in 1990.

### Early International Censorship

The novel was banned in Ireland and Australia in 1932, with the latter maintaining its censorship for five years. The first of many instances of the novel's censorship occurred in Ireland in 1932, almost immediately after its publication. Ireland's action to censor the book became a trend in other countries. Quickly following afterwards, in the same year, Australia followed the trend.(no content)In 1967, India banned Brave New World, likening the work to pornography. Another pivotal moment came in 1965 when Brave New World was banned in India for its depiction of a dystopian society, which was deemed as a negative portrayal of the country.
